author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: فِي كِتابِكَ العَظِيمِ وَقُلْتَ يا مَلأَ البَيانِ اتَّقُوا الرَّحْمنَ وَلا تَكْفُرُوا بِالَّذِيْ جَعَلْتُ البَيانَ وَرَقَةً مِنْ أَوْراقِ جَنَّتِهِ، وَإِنَّهُ كانَ هَدِيَّةً مِنْ عِنْدِيْ إِلَيْهِ إِنْ فازَ بِالقَبُولِ إِنَّهُ لَهُو الفَضَّالُ وَإِنْ طُرِدَ وَما فازَ إِنَّهُ لَهُو الحاكِمُ
translation: Thou art the One, O my God and my Ruler, Who hast sent down Thy Book that Thou mayest manifest my Cause, and glorify my Word. Through it Thou didst enter into a Covenant, concerning me, with all that hath been created in Thy realm. Thou seest, O Beloved of the world, how the rebellious among Thy creatures have made of that Covenant a bulwark for themselves, and through it have withdrawn from Thy Beauty, and repudiated Thy signs.
